thread.title: Wolves stay perfect with comeback win
thread.title_full: Wolves stay perfect with comeback win

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Wolves stay perfect with comeback win
text:
Wolves stay perfect with comeback win Sep 29, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
WINFIELD — The Winfield-Mt. Union football team moved to 5-0 on Friday night after a comeback win over Lone Tree at home. The Wolves and Lions came into the game with matching 2-0 conference records, but it was W-MU who stayed unbeaten with a 30-20 win. 
The Lions struck big in the first half with three touchdowns, two through the air and one on the ground. After outscoring opponents 180-6 in their first four games, the Wolves found themselves in a 20-6 hole at halftime. 
The Wolves’ defense came out for the second half with something to prove. They shut out Lone Tree in the final two quarters, and bought time for the offense to score three times with two-point conversions after each touchdown. 
Trailing 30-20 with just under four minutes left in the fourth quarter, the Lions had a red zone opportunity to cut into the W-MU lead, but the Wolves stayed true and completed the second-half shutout. 
Offensively, W-MU used a solid ground game to fight their way to the win. The Wolves scored four touchdowns in the game, all coming from the red zone. 
Kolt Rossiter went 9-16 passing in the win with 79 yards and a touchdown. He also ran for 53 yards and finished the game with two rushing touchdowns. 
Darren Hunter went over 100 yards rushing for the third time this season. He had 152 yards in 24 carries and scored one touchdown. Hunter also caught two balls for 35 yards. 
Bryce Robison led the team in receptions, with four, and receiving yards, with 35. He also picked up 44 yards rushing on 24 carries. Zach Davis had two receptions in the game for 19 receiving yards and one touchdown. Kaleb Hagge had 10 yards rushing on three carries. 
Sam Jennings had another dominating day on defense. He led the team with 10.5 tackles. Warren Krieger-Coble had 9.5 tackles and one tackle for a loss. Robison had 6.5 tackles, Matthew Niebuhr had six, and Jordan Hudson had five. 
The Wolves moved to 3-0 in conference with the win, and are now tied with Pekin and WACO at the top of Class A District 6. W-MU will travel to New London (2-3, 1-2) on Friday night.
